data.name: RichTextBox1.Text
data.value:
03 - Statistics Homework within 20/10/2022 Alberto Spinella - 2076802 Teacher: professor Tommaso Gastaldi Used language: VB
This program read a CSV file obtained from a Wireshark sniffing session and creates some contingency tables. If you want to change the path of "ping.csv" file, just drag an drop it on the textBox below or select through the explorer. To discover more about the context, scroll down this RichTextBox: CONTINUE
There are 4 hosts. Their IP are: ServerA - 172.17.0.2 ServerB - 172.17.0.3 ServerC - 172.17.0.4 ServerD - 172.17.0.5
What happens is: - ServerA sends 4 ICMP packets to ServerB; - ServerC sends 4 ICMP packets to ServerB; - ServerD sends 2 ICMP packets to ServerA; - ServerA sends 3 ICMP packets to ServerC; - ServerD sends 5 ICMP packets to ServerC.
Every sent ICMP generate 2 packets, and 2 consequent replies. So, by "ServerA sends 4 ICMP packets to ServerB" means there are 4 requests (8 packets) and 4 replies (8 packets), for a total of 16 packets.
The visual result captured with Wireshark is available in the README.md related to this repo, at this link: XXX And, also, it is available at my statistics' homework 03 blog page, at this link: XXX
